meanings.definition: To create a new word or phrase by altering an existing one.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys recoining words to make them sound more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The author is recoining old sayings to fit modern times.
meanings.sent3: By recoining the phrase, he added a touch of humor to the conversation.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity in recoining language is like painting with words.
meanings.sent5: The process of recoining can breathe new life into dull expressions.

meanings.definition: To make a new version of a coin.
meanings.sent1: The mint is recoining the currency to improve its durability.
meanings.sent2: They are recoining the old coins to commemorate a special event.
meanings.sent3: Recoining the coins gave them a shiny, fresh appearance.
meanings.sent4: The act of recoining the currency symbolizes progress and change.
meanings.sent5: The art of recoining coins requires precision and skill.
